meta.description: Comprehensive accessibility rules guide for LLMs to reference when ensuring WCAG compliance in React and Next.js applications

accessibilityRules.title: Images Must Have Alt Text
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure all images are accessible to screen readers.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Always provide meaningful alt text. Use alt="" for decorative images.

accessibilityRules.title: Interactive Elements Must Be Keyboard Accessible
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure clickable elements are accessible via keyboard.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use semantic <button> elements or add keyboard handlers and tabIndex.

accessibilityRules.title: ARIA Roles Must Have Required Attributes
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Follow ARIA Authoring Practices for required attributes.

accessibilityRules.title: Form Inputs Must Have Labels
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use <label> elements or ARIA attributes to associate labels with inputs.

accessibilityRules.title: Correct Heading Hierarchy
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use headings in a nested manner without skipping levels.

accessibilityRules.title: Visible Focus Indicator
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure keyboard users can see focus.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Do not remove focus indicators; customize them if necessary.

accessibilityRules.title: No Focusable Elements Inside aria-hidden
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Avoid placing focusable elements inside aria-hidden containers.

accessibilityRules.title: Page Must Have Accessible Title
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Provide a unique and descriptive title for each page.

accessibilityRules.title: Sufficient Color Contrast
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure readability for users with visual impairments.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Maintain WCAG AA color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text).

accessibilityRules.title: Links Must Have Descriptive Text
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure links are meaningful out of context.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use descriptive link text instead of 'Click here'. Avoid titles that only say 'link'.

accessibilityRules.title: Logical Focus Order
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure keyboard navigation follows a logical order.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Maintain a logical tab order and manage focus properly in interactive components.

accessibilityRules.title: Provide Skip Navigation Links
accessibilityRules.intent: Enable screen reader users to skip repetitive content.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Include skip to main content links at the beginning of pages.

accessibilityRules.title: Provide Captions for Audio and Video
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure deaf and hard of hearing users can access media content.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Provide captions for videos and transcripts for audio content.

accessibilityRules.title: Respect Prefers Reduced Motion
accessibilityRules.intent: Avoid triggering seizures and reduce motion for motion-sensitive users.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Respect prefers-reduced-motion media query and avoid flashing content.

accessibilityRules.title: Error Messages Must Be Clear
accessibilityRules.intent: Ensure form errors are clearly communicated.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Provide clear, specific error messages and suggestions for correction.

accessibilityRules.title: Support Text Resizing
accessibilityRules.intent: Allow users to resize text without losing functionality.
accessibilityRules.recommendation: Use relative units (em, rem) for text sizing. Test with 200% zoom.
